intro: Diaphananthe alfredii, commonly known as the Alfred's diaphananthe, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
